reviews.title: Wonderful November Weekend
reviews.text: The Lodge is a series of buildings with one main registration/restaurant/gift shop building, and several other buildings for rooms/suites and cabins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The two of us stayed for four nights in one of the suites. The main reason we chose a suite was that we wanted the refrigerator and extra sink, and we also thought the extra space would be nice. And it was. The suite was nicely furnished with two large rooms, one shared bathroom with tub and toilet, and two sink areas on either side of the shared bathroom. The back balcony was fairly small, but had a double-seater sort of Adirondack-style wooden chair and a small table. We kept our ice chest back there (this is November), and there was still enough room to bring one of the inside table chairs out when we needed.
reviews.title: Great Location, less Great Room

likes.disliked: — Person at check in, matress too thin and sheets didn't fit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite was on the back side of the building. The balcony faced straight out onto a close canyon wall, with a steep hill leading up to the wall. The hill was covered with trees, and five or six mule deer lived beneath the trees. To either side there were views up and down the canyon of some of the other large formations, but the balcony did not have what I would describe as a spacious view. But we enjoyed it greatly, sitting in the quiet and watching the mule deer forage.
reviews.title: Great room, great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom contained a very large and quite comfortable king-size bed, a desk and chair, and a cabinet with shelves which had glasses in it (4 regular glasses and 4 wine glasses) and a couple of dresser drawers. The sitting room had a well-worn but comfortable sofa, three armchairs, a coffee table, an end table with lamp, and a sitting table with two chairs. The table is sized for two people.
reviews.title: Location, location, locatin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: I couldn't tell from the room description on the Lodge site just what the refrigerator/sink setup was. The sink is not a kitchen-type sink; it's just a second bathroom sink and countertop. The refrigerator is a very small half-size fridge under the countertop. It's big enough to hold the contents of a cooler and a bottle of wine, which was all we needed, and it was good and cold, so it worked great for our purposes. We ate lunch each day from food we brought with us, and between the fridge, the sink (which we used to wash dishes with some dishwashing soap we brought with us), and the cooler which we kept out on the balcony, everything was fine. There are no food/drink amenities other than the drink and wine glasses and the coffee mugs (see below). There's an ice machine on the ground floor. One very nice touch was that each sink has a filtered water spout which is perfect for filling canteens.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a self organised tour. When we stayed before we stayed in the cabins, but when I booked there were none available, so I booked into the 'motel' style rooms. I must admit that I was a bit dubious about this, as felt that to get the best experience you need the cabin. However, I was proved wrong.
reviews.title: Our Second Visit here and would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The motel rooms are really lovely, very spacious, we had one at the back with lovely views of the mountains all around, and it was so peaceful. Each room has a balcony, with nice rocking chairs to relax in, and the rooms have TVs, and free wi fi access - something not available in the other national parks we visited.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I suppose my only grumble would be that you only really have one restaurant to chose from, and this is a bit pricey, although all our meals will really good, and we did share a couple of meals to try to keep the costs under control. Would definitely recommend Zion Lodge - hope to return again
reviews.title: basic comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I just wanted to share our recent experience at the Zion Lodge. Simply put, it was WONDERFUL. This lodge is truly a gem in our national park system and you cannot go wrong staying here. We had a queen hotel room on the 2nd floor, #214, and it was comfortable, clean and served our needs well. The air conditioner cooled the room to perfection and we had it set pretty low since it was well over 100 degrees outside. The location is truly awesome and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. A huge thank you to the staff and management of this lodge. I can't wait to plan my next stay here.
reviews.title: Can really recommend Zion Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like all the properties we visited in the national parks, this place was rustic but clean and adequate for our needs and we enjoyed our 1 night stay here. We ate in the restaurant and had a nice meal, Unfortunately we couldn't eat on the balcony as the bugs were biting!
reviews.title: Can't beat the location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a three day stay in the cabin accomodations. the cabin had
reviews.title: Cabins quaint, park wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: a cute porch, fireplace and twin beds (A little short for our 6'3" frames) It was well worth staying in the park though. The restaurant in the lodge offered good food and service. Had to cram about 100 people in the little bar area to watch the only TV set around (baseball play-offs)...so much for roughing it! The park has wonderful hiking trails for both the brave and feeble-hearted. Zion is lovely....big horn sheep were spectacular!
reviews.title: Well Worth It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife, 1.5 year old son, and I stayed at the Zion Lodge from 9/17/07 - 9/19/07. Our room was approximately $165 a night.
reviews.title: Great location, fine accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was motel style with 2 queen size beds. The room was clean and spacious. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Location is all it has going for it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night in the main lodge. The room was a little dark, but overall was better than average. There was a small balcony, which we sat out and watched the deer outside.
reviews.title: It's the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dark motel style lodge room not helped by having 'eco' lighting which kept it looking pretty glum at night. Beyond that, all was good. The bed was comfy,wi-fi ok, bathroom fine, everything spotlesss. Lodge room was said to have a river view but it would have required a flash flood to have seen it from our nice balcony. The main lodge building had several convenient features ... take away breakfasts, a good gift shop with a pretty good choice of walking clothing at, for Xanterra, not too outrageous prices, We're glad we booked in the park rather than outside. All the walks were just to hand and very enjoyable. The scenery is gorgeous(npi). The guy selling real ales on draught was like an angel from heaven after the walks, the beer was good too ...such a nice change from the cold but bland usual US offerings.
reviews.title: Nicely located in well maintained grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a first floor room, loved sitting out on our little porch, watching the wildlife gather at dusk, and enjoying the view of the lovely rock formations. The room was large and quiet, had a tv, unlike the cabins, always good for catching weather forecasts. Zion is one of our favorite parks, the fact that cars can't go any further then the lodge turned out to be a real plus, it keeps the park so quiet and relaxing. The shuttles run constantly but they are so very quiet. We did a lot of hiking, hopping the shuttle when convenient. We hopped on the shuttle at night to go to the top to star gaze away from any lights, beautiful. The food in the restaurant was very good, nice gift shop and snack bar. I would gladly stay right there again.
reviews.title: Book ahead, you'll be glad you did.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife and i stayed here in august and we loved it the scenery is breathtaking . the room we had was on the second floor and had a balcony with a table and chairs the room was well furnished and spotlessly clean i only wish we had a longer stay the place is fantastic we liked it better than yosemitie as its smaller we would definatly love to return one day
reviews.title: outstanding place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If Zion National Park is on your list of destinations (and it should be) you really must stay at Zion Lodge. Comfy rooms w/amazing views from your balcony, great restaurant, convenient tram service to trailheads and into town. Worth the price and book early.
reviews.title: Comfty, Convenient Zion Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in one if the historic cabins. They do not have a minifridge. Lovely fireplace and a comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Cabins!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights in the Zion National Park Lodge. The room was spacious, clean with a balcony that looked out at one of the incredible Zion rock formations. Each room has a balcony where you can sit and watch the sun moving up and down the cliffs, the people enjoying the green grass in front, and deer and wild turkeys who will come right up to your balcony.The food at the lodge Grille was excellent and reasonably priced. There is also a smaller restaurant where you can get sandwiches, smoothies, etc. Because of the number of people who visit Zion, cars are not permitted on the park road beyond the lodge, but their shuttle system is excellent and runs quite often. Be sure and make you reservations as early as possible - at least six months or more.
reviews.title: Incredible Views in an Incredible Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time staying here (hotel rooms). Both times we arrived early, and when we inquired where our room would be so we could park near it, they actually let us check in early. Super friendly service both times we've been there.
reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it to be in the park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms had been upgraded since last time with large TV and Internet access. We requested top floor, facing the cliff side. Our neighbors never came out on their balconies, so we had a nice quiet time relaxing there after hiking. In the evening, we were rewarded with bats darting around near the balcony, eating bugs (yay!). Another reason to face cliff side.
reviews.title: Great national park lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We didn't eat in the restaurant this time, but they had a beer garden which was pretty nice (and you can't beat the views!).
reviews.title: Ideal location for exploring Zion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: All the hotel, gift shop & beer garden staff were super nice. We'd loved just parking the car and taking the shuttle wherever we wanted (with service every 5 minutes). There is also a shuttle into the nearby town, which we used one night to go out to dinner. Very convenient and free!
reviews.title: wonderful situation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we book early these lodge, we want to be in the park and we didn't regret it at all, my only regret is we didn't stay longer, service, food is great, the cabins are cozy, with fire place, nice aircondition, confortable beds, all you need , ecofriendly, The restaurant experience after climbing ''angels landing"" was yummy, good wine selection Yvonne our server was wonderful, I will like to come back in april or later with snow around, Zion is a park you can stay for 4-5 days and don't get bored
reviews.title: perfect place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of my favorite hotels ever. Amazing hotel within the park itself and at the foot of some great trail heads and where the bus leaves for other areas of the park so handy for getting around (you can't drive into the park past the Lodge so have to catch the bus). You simply must book a cabin room, gorgeous, rustic (but in a luxurious way!) and a perfect way to spend some time in Zion. Fireplaces, large comfy beds, good sized bathrooms and a seperate room/area to store bags etc. A wonderful experience. Food in the restaurant is ok, but without travelling outside the park you are pretty much stuck with it. Book far ahead to get a room and book a cabin!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Zion Lodge. We had been tent camping for two night and needed a shower and a comfortable bed. We stayed in the motel and not one of the cabins. The room was nice. The staff was friendly. We appreciated the efforts that the Zion Lodge was doing for conservation. The lodge is located were you can start many different hikes. Plan to do one of them. We would recommend the Zion Lodge.
reviews.title: Plan a stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Book early because there is nothing better than staying in the park. The Zion Lodge is a gem. Lovely lodge rooms but we chose to stay in a cabin. No need for a TV and it was air conditioned which is a plus since the lodge in Bryce wasn't. Spectacular views! Restaurant was delicious and our server Bonnie was wonderful. There's a cafe on ground level to get sandwiches or ice cream as an option. You can watch deer grazing on the grounds not concerned at having people nearby. The lodge is a stop on the park shuttle route. There are hiking trails right from the lodge also. We were lucky to visit the end of august with a full moon, so at night we took our travel blanket and pillows out on the lawn and watched a beautifully clear sky, shooting stars, and towering rock cliffs on all sides. A family of deer grazed within 15 feet of us. You'd have to be a poet to describe how wonderful it was.
reviews.title: A gem in the park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: A good place to stay...but call instead of making reservations over the 'net. That way you can (if you prefer) request a ground floor room and check if cabins were available. Wehn i made online reservations, no cabins evern showed up as being in the Park.
reviews.title: Geology Tour of the Southwest US
Nice bed, shame about the food
reviews.text: Zion Lodge itself is lovely - great surroundings and lodgings. On site shuttle buses so access is easy for all. You can drive up to the Lodge if you are a guest, but can't use your car around the Park - use the shuttles - they are really frequent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Only gripe is the over priced on site restaurant. They had run out of steak when we were there and the pork had about 4 cloves of garlic per slice. Catch the shuttle to Springdale (they run late in the evening) and try a restaurant there - we wish we did.
reviews.title: Western Cabin had charm and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008
reviews.text: Our family of four liked our cabin in this most beautiful of National Parks. It was a long walk to the main lodge building which housed the visitor's center and restaurant. Even lodge guest rooms are not in the main building, but in another, large 2 story unit that is adjacent to the visitor's center.
reviews.title: Think "Federal Bureacracy"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008
reviews.text: The room had a fireplace which we did not use, a table and chair and two full size beds (not queen). The bathroom had a nice setup with the toilet and tub/shower/sink in it's own room and a large dressing area with an additional sink, ample counterspace, shelf for luggage an a closet rod with hangars. This was great setup for a group such as ours. No TV.
reviews.title: Good Location but No Ambiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lodge does not provide conditioner, opting for earth friendly soap/shampoo dispenser.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent two nights here – one night in a cabin, and one night in the motel-style lodge itself. Both were disappointing for different reasons. First, the cabin was old and not insulated. So we had to rely on a gas fireplace that kept going out, as well as a room heater that blew cold air. As for the shower, the water wasn’t even lukewarm. In fact, it was so cold that we didn’t bathe in the morning. We later found out that four cabins share one hot-water heater, so the first person to use the shower will exhaust the supply of hot water. We were told it takes about a half hour for the water to get warm again.
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings, mediocre lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: We were able to move from that horrible cabin to the motel-style lodge on the grounds. Though much more clean and comfortable and the shower more in line with what one would expect, it lacked all other amenities: like the cabin, there was no TV, no fridge, no microwave. If this were a lodge for monks, that might be fine, but in the evenings, it would have been nice to have those amenities, especially at the prices we paid.
reviews.title: Stay Away from Zion Lodge...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: We loved Zion Park itself, but the lodge accommodations left something to be desired. We will visit again, but will stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: Location is all that matters at this place....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been to nearly 15 National Parks in 1 year, and in many Parks we've stayed at the concessioner provided lodging inside the park (eg: ARAMARK at Shenandoah, and Delaware North Companies at Sequoia). Zion Lodge, managed by Xanterra, was by far the worst and ironically the most expensive accomodation. We paid a $166 per night for a king size room. Rooms were plain, no coffee, no refrigirator, no TV, hot water in the showers takes 10 minutes to come (funny, they have "save water" reminders everywhere), no free breakfast, no internet, dirty patios, and toilets with human hair. All facilities such as the coffee bar close early.
reviews.title: Location is all......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007
reviews.text: I recommend that you book a nice Best Western in Springdale, just 5 minutes drive from the entrance where they have all the facilities mentioned above at only $70.08 per night!
reviews.title: Great Thanksgiving Stay
